summary: Max Lesnick was a Cuban exile involved in anti-Castro activities. The documents suggest he was connected to other Cuban exiles and potentially involved in terrorist activities. He is mentioned in the context of the travel plans of AMBANG-1 and associates in 1965, and later in cables and reports from 1979 detailing his associations with exile groups and potential terrorist connections. He appears in documents related to Orlando Bosch and Cuban exile activities in the 1970s.
significance: The significance of Max Lesnick in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated in the provided documents. However, his connections to anti-Castro Cuban exiles and potential terrorist activities suggest a possible indirect link to individuals or groups who may have had motives related to the assassination. Further investigation would be needed to establish any direct connection.
